image.altText: An unused railway line in suburbia.

props.synopsis: With one-in-four spectators at the Macquarie Point stadium expected to arrive by bus, Hobart's public transport infrastructure could need a major shake-up. But a disused rail corridor is undergoing even more studies.

title.children: Fifteen years and 30 studies later, Tasmania to seek federal funds for 'rapid bus' line

image.altText: A person with long hair and glasses smiles while sitting inside a shed.

props.synopsis: Hobart-based performer Quin Thomson embarks on medical transition amid service shortages, as Tasmanian GPs working with trans and gender-diverse patients close their books.

title.children: 'My voice has been my living': Soprano's sacrifice for gender transition

image.altText: A rectangular cream house with a blue roof on a green hillside at sunset with trampoline, clothesline and trees surrounding.

props.synopsis: In a bid to support self-built low-cost housing, an architect who built his own property for $150,000, has released free plans for others to download and use.Â

title.children: Architect uploads free plan for owner-builders to use

image.altText: A man with a white beard and hair  wearing a black t-shirt and jeans sits on rocks by the water.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Braddon independent MP Craig Garland will put forward a motion in State Parliament calling for a referendum on the Macquarie Point stadium.

title.children: Independent MP Craig Garland calls for referendum on stadium

image.altText: Exterior shot of a paper mill

props.synopsis: General manger Pat Dooley says the funds will help the Tasmanian business stabilise, prepare for major investments and transition to renewable energy.

title.children: Boyer Paper Mill secures $24m fund pledge to 'transition away from coal'

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has been hinting it was seeking to move away from the planning process underway to assess the contentious Macquarie Point stadium. It's now official.

title.children: Tasmanian government to ditch current planning process for AFL stadium

image.altText: Marijuana vapes in the form of a car key, air pods case and lip balm products.

props.synopsis: They can look just like a pen that actually works, lip gloss, a car key or an airpod case. They're called penjamins â disguised to look like everyday objects, allowing the user to vape cannabis discreetly.

title.children: Is it a key? Is it a pen? Is it a chapstick? No, it's a weed vape

image.altText: A suburban house seen through a wooden house frame

props.synopsis: Both major parties have pitched housing sector reform but experts say the lack of housing supply in Australia is not being adequately addressed.

title.children: Labor and Coalition housing policies could drive up prices, experts say

image.altText: Donald Trump and Nayib Bukele stand at a White House entrance.

props.synopsis: As world leaders scramble to get the ear of US President Donald Trump, the self-described "world's coolest dictator" scores a coveted White House meeting.Â

title.children: 'World's coolest dictator' meets Trump after jailing US deportees

image.altText: A young homeless person sits on a park bench with their back to the camera. You cannot see their face.

props.synopsis: Every four days a homeless person aged between 15 and 24 dies, and the majority of deaths are due to suicide.

title.children: Every four days a young homeless person dies. Advocates want urgent reform

image.altText: A man looks through prison bars.

props.synopsis: To survive the Syrian prison known as the "human slaughterhouse", Moaz had to live a lie. Then it got real.

title.children: Moaz faked being a doctor. Then he was asked to do something terrifying

image.altText: Uncle Carey wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: A large majority of Aboriginal community-owned health facilities in Victoria are in urgent need of infrastructure funding, according to a new report from the state's top advisory body and peak body for Indigenous health.Â

title.children: Indigenous elders say crumbling health facilities are fracturing community

image.altText: An Apple logo hangs above the entrance to the Apple store in Manhattan, New York City

props.synopsis: Australian shares are up modestly after Wall Street gains. Shares in Apple rose on the news of an iPhone tariff exemption, while Donald Trump signalled a shift on auto tariffs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Wall Street rises as tariff exemptions boost tech stocks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Star shares to return to trade tomorrow

image.altText: A smiling man in a hat and sunglasses sits on a boat.

props.synopsis: Brett Williams had "2.1 million reasons" not to kill Craig Dunn on the day the sale of his property was to be finalised, when the tenant who made his life a living hell would finally be out of his life.

title.children: Widow tells of dreams stolen by landlord who killed her husband

image.altText: A woman in a blazer and a pearl necklace

props.synopsis: Independents Monique Ryan and David Pocock say content made by social media creators paid for by politicians should be disclosed.Â

title.children: Monique Ryan says paid influencer posts must be disclosed after awkward on-air moment

image.altText: A composite image of two women, one Liah Yoo

props.synopsis: American beauty founders are warning prices are likely to go up as the global skincare and cosmetics industry comes to terms with Donald Trump's new tariff regime.Â

title.children: 'Hurts me so much': How Trump caused chaos in the K-beauty world

image.altText: Two young children reach for sandwiches, grapes and carrots from colourful lunch boxes at school.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt will spend his week in Queensland, seeking to sandbag the party's three seats of Griffith, Ryan and Brisbane and announcing the Greens would push to establish an $11.6 billion free school lunches program in the next term of parliament.

title.children: Greens in week-long 'retain Brisbane bender' with free school lunch pledge

image.altText: Male and female police officers carrying backpacks and bags exit a home and walk down stairs at night time.

props.synopsis: The 65-year-old woman was inside the Ambarvale house at the time of the attack and died after sustaining a wound to her leg.

image.altText: A composite image of two posters of Zoe Daniel and Tim Wilson.

props.synopsis: Across the historically conservative stronghold of Goldstein, voters are tuning in for a federal election rematch between the Liberals and the teals. These are some of the issues on their minds.

title.children: 'They've had their time': Can a teal MP win a second go in Goldstein?

image.altText: Two men wearing suits and ties looking slightly disgruntled.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers and Angus Taylor have clashed over housing policy during a heated debate about Australia's economy on 7.30.

props.synopsis: Housing ministers face-off on Q+A after big-spending pledges for first home buyers in campaign launches on Sunday.

title.children: Housing ministers face off on Q+A on key voting issue

title.children: Zelenskyy urges Trump to visit Ukraine as Russia accused of 'war crime' in Sumy

image.altText: Child playing with differnt colour balls of play dough on table before him. Face not visible

props.synopsis: Thousands of documents released by the NSW education department show a lack of knowledge by childcare providers about the laws that are designed to protect children in their charge.

title.children: 'High risk' childcare provider took test four times before running centre

image.altText: A sun setting behind clouds at Lake Menindee in outback NSW.

props.synopsis: As a mass of water makes its way down from Queensland, the Menindee Lakes in outback New South Wales could be the beneficiary. Having slowly dried up for months, the fortunes of the bird and fish sanctuary may be about to change.Â

title.children: Up to 1 trillion litres of floodwater may hit outback's Menindee Lakes

image.altText: Apollo Bay hotel next to Great Ocean Road with people crossing hte road. Hill in the background.

props.synopsis: A caravan park once known as a "sleepy hollow" will cut down the number of sites and introduce glamping, but some locals say it's not what the town and its visitors need.

title.children: Great Ocean Road campground to get a glow-up, but not everyone's happy

image.altText: Josh Shapiro in a navy jacket speaking at a wooden lectern in front of police officers

props.synopsis: A suspected arsonist has been charged with attempted homicide, terrorism and aggravated arson, accused of setting fire to the home of Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro.

title.children: Man charged with attempted murder and terrorism after US governor's home targeted in fire

image.altText: woman holding her dog while on the phone

props.synopsis: We look at your obligations when it comes to calling in sick, including what to say and what evidence you may need.Â

title.children: How to call in sick and what evidence you need

image.altText: Man with short black hair and glasses wearing a suit and tie speaks in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Industrial Relations Commission is considering whether to reopen a discrimination claim from suspended Townsville mayor Troy Thompson against the city council.

title.children: Suspended mayor lodges $1m discrimination claim amid corruption probe

image.altText: A film still of Richard Roxburgh, a middle-aged blond man, in a blue button-down, with his hands on a car bonnet.

props.synopsis: After 400 days in prison in Egypt, Peter Greste was released in 2015. He turned the ordeal into a memoir about press freedom, and now a movie, starring Richard Roxburgh.

title.children: In 2013, an Aussie journalist was arrested in Egypt. His story is now a movie

image.altText: a nsw police van next to the water during the search for a driver in the parramatta river

props.synopsis: Police divers have recovered the body of an 86-year-old man after he drove his car into the Parramatta River, hitting his elderly wife while she was standing on the riverbank.

title.children: Police recover man's body from Parramatta River after car plunged into water

image.altText: A micro chip seen on a circuit board

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says new levies on semiconductor imports into the US will be announced in the coming week, with their "national security" impacts to be investigated.

title.children: Trump to impose new chip tariffs, including on electronics exempted days ago

image.altText: A black labrador sits next to a woman in a green top who is laughing.

props.synopsis: Researchers are looking for overweight golden retrievers and labradors to take part in a study on dog health.

title.children: Overweight labradors helping research obesity impact on dogs

image.altText: The sun rises above a highway. The sky is coloured red and yellow.

props.synopsis: Young Australians are most at risk, according to new research by the University of Adelaide.Â

title.children: 'Only going to get worse': Extreme heat linked to rise in mental health disorders

image.altText: A yellow box which reads "Glad Wrap" in red

props.synopsis: The manufacturer of GLAD waste disposal and food storage bags, hit with $8.25 million federal penalty for making incorrect product recycling claims.

title.children: Clorox fined $8.25m over misleading 'ocean plastic' claims on GLAD bags
